endpoints.description: Submit a batch of transactions for risk evaluation and anomaly detection.
Retrieve a list of the most recent alerts generated by the monitoring system.
Flag a specific transaction as suspicious by its unique identifier.
Remove the suspicious flag from a specific transaction.
Add a new detection rule to the monitoring system.
Delete a specific detection rule based on its identifier.
Retrieve statistics on transaction monitoring, such as the number of detected anomalies.
Submit user feedback regarding specific alerts to improve the accuracy of the detection system.
Access historical monitoring data for a specified time period.
Update user or organizational settings for monitoring preferences.
